name: Acropolis
description: An ancient citadel on a rocky outcrop above Athens, containing the remains of historically significant buildings, such as the Parthenon.

name: Alhambra
description: A beautiful palace and fortress complex, known for its Moorish architecture and intricate tilework.
keyFacts: Example of Islamic architecture in Europe
Originally built by the Nasrid dynasty
Surrounded by lush gardens and fountains

name: Angkor Wat
description: The largest religious monument in the world, originally built as a Hindu temple, later becoming a Buddhist temple.

name: Colosseum
description: An ancient amphitheater in Rome, known for hosting gladiatorial games and other public spectacles.

name: Eiffel Tower
description: A wrought-iron lattice tower, an iconic symbol of Paris and one of the most visited landmarks in the world.

name: Great Wall of China
description: A vast network of fortifications built to protect China from invasions, stretching over 13,000 miles.
keyFacts: One of the New Seven Wonders of the World
Symbol of China's strength and resilience

name: Machu Picchu
description: An ancient Incan city located high in the Andes, known for its sophisticated stone construction and stunning mountain views.
keyFacts: One of the New Seven Wonders of the World

name: Petra
description: A historical city carved into red sandstone cliffs by the Nabateans, known for its impressive rock-cut architecture.
keyFacts: Famous for the Treasury and Monastery

name: Pyramid of Giza
description: The Great Pyramid of Giza, the largest of the pyramids, was built as a tomb for Pharaoh Khufu and is the only surviving ancient wonder.
keyFacts: Oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World

name: Roman Forum
description: The central area of ancient Rome, housing important government buildings, temples, and markets.
keyFacts: Center of political and social life in ancient Rome
Contains ruins of ancient temples and basilicas

name: Stonehenge
description: A prehistoric monument consisting of a circle of standing stones, its purpose remains a mystery, with theories of astronomical or religious significance.
keyFacts: One of the most famous prehistoric sites
Stones weigh up to 25 tons each
Aligned with the sunrise of the summer solstice

name: Taj Mahal
description: A white marble mausoleum built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal, celebrated for its stunning beauty.
keyFacts: One of the New Seven Wonders of the World
